com.engine.graphics

Class ParticleGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engine.graphics.ParticleGenerator

  • public class ParticleGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    WORK IN PROGRESS

    --------------------

    ParticleGenerator

    ParticleGenerator generates Particles and handles how they act. This is used to create particle effects such as rain, dust, smoke, etc.

    Particle Generator Parameters:

    • Spread: The typical distance between each particle
    • Rate: The rate at which particles are emitted
    • Speed: The speed of particle movement
    • Duration: The amount of time to generate particles
    • Scope: The particle generation type. (See ParticleGenerator constants)

    Generation Scopes:

    • CONE_UP: Emit particles in an upward cone with point facing down
    • CONE_DOWN: Emit particles in a downward cone with point facing up
    • CONE_LEFT: Emit particles in a cone with point facing right
    • CONE_RIGHT: Emit particles in a cone with point facing left
    • CIRCLE_SINGLE: Emit particles in a single circular

    Author:
    Ryan Hochmuth

    • Method Detail

      • startGenerator

        public void startGenerator()
        Start the generator. This doesn't actually generate particles, it's just used to control the generation. Like turning it on.

      • stopGenerator

        public void stopGenerator()
        Stop the generator. Note this will clear all of the current particles.

      • generateParticles

        public void generateParticles(java.awt.Graphics g,
                              float xPos,
                              float yPos)
        Generate and randomize particles. This is where the actual generation of particles happens. In order for this to work, this method must be continuously called in a render method.
        Parameters:
        g - - the graphics to use for drawing
        xPos - - the x position to draw at
        yPos - - the y position to draw at

        Returns:
